intro: Blepharidium, commonly known as the eye-plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, umbrella-like inflorescence that resembles a closed eye, giving it its common name. The plant typically has finely divided, feather-like leaves that are often aromatic. Blepharidium species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in moist, shaded environments. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and sometimes for their medicinal properties.
